subject: Parenting
title: Connection Before Correction
description: A micro-lesson that makes Connection Before Correction usable.

hook.text: A child throws a toy in anger. You kneel down and say 'I can see you're really frustrated.' She stops.

buildup.text: Connection before correction means acknowledging the emotion before addressing the behavior.

discovery.text: Neuroscience confirms: a child's brain must feel safe before it can receive instruction.

twist.text: This isn't permissiveness ‚Äî you still address the behavior. But connection comes first because the brain demands it.

climax.text: Children who feel understood are far more likely to accept correction and change their behavior.

punchline.text: Connect first. Correct second. The order matters.

quiz.question: Why does connection need to come before correction?
options: The brain must feel safe before it can receive instruction
It's a permissive approach that skips correction
Connection is more important than behavior
